Uses of Class
xxl.core.indexStructures.RTree

  • Packages that use RTree 
    Package Description
    xxl.core.indexStructures
    Provides important index structures like B-trees, R-trees, M-trees and bulk-loading-algorithms.
    xxl.core.indexStructures.rtrees  
    xxl.core.spatial
    Support data types and building-blocks for spatial, temporal and mining algorithms (e.g. similarity joins)
    xxl.core.spatial.cursors
    Provides mappers for different type of Point and Rectangle objects as well as several join algorithms: nested loops distance similarity-join for Points, the spatial join algorithm based on space-filling curves proposed by Jack Orenstein, similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" and hash-based plane sweep for two-dimensional data.
    xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors
    A collection of spatial queries.
    xxl.core.spatial.histograms.utils  

    • Uses of RTree in xxl.core.indexStructures

      Subclasses of RTree in xxl.core.indexStructures 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GreenesRTree
      An RTree implementing the split-strategy proposed by D.
      class  LinearRTree
      An RTree implementing the linear split-strategy proposed in the original R-Tree paper.
      class  LinearRTreeAT
      An RTree implementing the split-strategy proposed by C.H.
      class  QuadraticRTree
      An RTree implementing the quadratic split-strategy proposed in the original R-Tree paper.
      class  RevisedRTree
      Revised R*-Tree For a detailed discussion see Norbert Beckmann, Bernhard Seeger: "A Rivised R*-Tree in Comparsion with Related Index Structures"
      class  XTree
      The XTree is a variant of the RTree for high dimensional data which avoids splits which would result in high overlap.

    • Uses of RTree in xxl.core.indexStructures.rtrees

      Subclasses of RTree in xxl.core.indexStructures.rtrees 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BufferedRtree<E>
      Implementation of R-tree with buffer technique designed by Lars Arge, Klaus Hinrichs, Jan Vahrenhold, Jeffrey Scott Vitter: Efficient Bulk Operations on Dynamic R-Trees.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      R-tree to bulk load; R-tree is initialized and ready to use after bulk loading is finished.

      Methods in xxl.core.indexStructures.rtrees with parameters of type RTree 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int RtreeIterativeBulkloader.RtreeIterativeBulkloaderAsynch.writeLevel(Iterator data, int level, int partitionSize, RTree rtree, Container treeContainer, int B) 
      int AbstractIterativeRtreeBulkloader.writeLevel(Iterator data, int level, int partitionSize, RTree rtree, Container treeContainer, int B)
      Default processing; Reads the level data, partitions is in chunks of size equal to partitionSize computes optimal partitioning for each chunk and writes into auxiliary storage for a next level generation
      MapEntry<Long,DoublePointRectangle> AbstractIterativeRtreeBulkloader.writeNode(List<?> entries, int level, RTree rtree, Container treeContainer)
      Writes node to a R-tree container
      int RtreeIterativeBulkloader.RtreeIterativeBulkloaderAsynch.writePartition(int[] distribution, Iterator data, int level, int B, RTree rtree, Container treeContainer)
      writes a partition according computed distribution
      int AbstractIterativeRtreeBulkloader.writePartition(int[] distribution, Iterator data, int level, int B, RTree rtree, Container treeContainer)
      Default method for processing a chunk a of level data after applying the optimal partitioning
      Constructors in xxl.core.indexStructures.rtrees with parameters of type RTree 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractIterativeRtreeBulkloader(RTree tree, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double storageUtil, int partitionSize) 
      MainMemoryCollectionBulkLoader(RTree tree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double storageUtil, int partitionSize) 
      RtreeIterativeBulkloader(RTree tree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double storageUtil, int partitionSize) 
      RtreeIterativeBulkloaderAsynch(RTree tree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double storageUtil, int partitionSize) 
      STRBulkLoader(RTree rtree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double nodeUtil, int[] sortingFunction)
      For initializing the STR loader we need an Rtree, number of dimensions, blocksize, storage utilization per node in percent and so called sortign function this provides the ordering of dimensions, since str sorts and partitions data according to one dimension at one step sorting function provides which dimension should be taken as next e.g. in two dimensional space we have 4 different sorting functions x,x or x,y or y,y, or x,x in this example we use a default one x,y
      TGSBulkLoader(RTree rtree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double nodeUtil, DoublePointRectangle universe) 
      TGSBulkLoader(RTree rtree, String path, int dimension, int blockSize, double ratio, double nodeUtil, DoublePointRectangle universe, double[] averageQuerySideLength)

      RegionQuery(RTree index, Geometry2D region, Function<KPE,Geometry2D> getGeometry)
      This is the most original form of the window query which only returns those geometries, which are overlapped by the query object.
